title: Finding profitable cryptocurrency pairs: search and analysis
subtitle: How to find profitable coin pairs to trade
body:
InterTrader sorts through _a lot_ of data to find you the most profitable opportunities. The outcome of its analysis is mostly presented on the [direct comparison page](/user-guide/compare-page/ "The Compare Page") for each market pair, and the search/analysis results page. Between these two sections, you'll find a lot of the key information you need. This page goes into more detail about the analysis results page. If you're looking for more general information, try the [quick start guide](/user-guide/ "User Guide"). ## Analysis Tap the `Compare` tab to go to the Analysis results. InterTrader will automatically search for profitable trades using default search criteria. > _If no results are found, it may be because it hasn't yet retrieved the data from the exchanges. Swipe down on the screen to refresh its data. This can a minute, but once done analysis is very quick._ When results are returned, you'll see something similar to this: ![Analysis results](/gin-data/images/1527773062124-analysis-results.png) ### What it all means Let's look at what the data for each item in the list means. > * The number of exchanges from which InterTrader gathered data for the pair * The difference between the lowest and highest buy price across all exchanges * The difference between the lowest and highest sell price across all exchanges * The potential profit at the time the price was retrieved by InterTrader â€” if *greyed out*, it means there's a problem with the coin or trading pair on at least one of the exchanges * There is a problem with the coin or the trading pair on one or more exchanges * _Updated..._ How long since the prices for the coin were updated

### Tips to make the most of the analysis results It's important to pay attention to the data provided for each item in the search results, as there are often indicators that _may_ make it difficult, or even impossible, to capitalise on the price differences. #### Warnings If there's an exclamation icon, or the profit is greyed out, make sure you click through to the [direct comparison page](/user-guide/compare-page/ "The Compare Page") to find out which exchanges have issues and if they'll affect your trade. #### Excessive buy/sell price differences or unusually high potential profit When there are large differences between the lowest and highest buy/sell prices, or significantly high profit can indicate that something is significantly skewing the figures. Causes can be, but aren't limited to: * Two different coins are being compared because of coin clash (two or more coins sharing the same ticker symbol) * There's a problem with the coin or trade pair on an exchange, causing the price to deviate significantly from the average of the other exchanges * The price is being manipulated on one of the exchanges (e.g. someone setting an inexplicably high buy price, usually for a very small quantity) Check the [direct comparison page](/user-guide/compare-page/ "The Compare Page") and review the orderbooks for exchanges of interest. #### Update time This is easily overlooked, but time passes quickly while trading and you can easily find yourself looking at results based on prices that are an hour old. Swipe down on the screen to refresh all the price data. > _Remember that the price update can take a minute, depending on your connection, so don't refresh too often._
